thread.title: New GM appointed for Pullman Bangkok Grande Sukhumvit
thread.title_full: New GM appointed for Pullman Bangkok Grande Sukhumvit

author: eTN Global Editor
title: New GM appointed for Pullman Bangkok Grande Sukhumvit
text:
New GM appointed for Pullman Bangkok Grande Sukhumvit   
Aug 17, 2015 Pullman Bangkok Grande Sukhumvit eTN   
BANGKOK, Thailand - AccorHotels has recently appointed Mr. Philippe Le Bourhis as General Manager of the newly rebranded, Pullman Bangkok Grande Sukhumvit (Previously Grand Millennium Sukhumvit). 
Philippe Le Bourhis, a French national, brings over 20 years of international experience at various Accor properties across Southeast Asia, with most of this time spent in properties in Indonesia and Thailand. Moving from the Pullman Jakarta Indonesia, this will be Philippe’s second Pullman rebranding, which with his wealth of experience, will sure to be another success. “I am excited about this new challenge and am happy to be back in the Land of Smiles,” said Philippe. 
Philippe will oversee the smooth transition, training and implementation of the Pullman brand while at the same time ensuring the unique Pullman experience for guests. “The rebranding of this hotel will emphasize its position of being not only a great place to stay but also “The Place to Meet,” an essential address for get-togethers,” said Philippe.
